page.title: 01GENERAL INFORMATION
page.content: The area is situated in the south east of Wiltshire, and comprises the greater part of the parish of Collingbourne Ducis with the southern part of Collingbourne Kingston. Most of the land lies between 100 and 250 metres above sea level.Along the western side of the area is the valley of the Bourne, a tributary of the river Avon. To the east of the valley are a number of dry valleys. The highest point is in the area of Gamman's Farm. The eastern boundary is marked by a steep drop to Shaw's Bottom. Land use over the area is mainly for agriculture, though the eastern half has an extensive wooded section. Most of the populated area is along the Bourne with a few isolated houses in the eastern part.
